name: Yuma AI
headline: The AI Support Agent for Ecommerce
description:
## What is Yuma AI?

Yuma is automating customer support by providing an AI Support Agent orchestration platform. Yuma provides autonomous AI agents dedicated to customer service and e-commerce.

We integrate directly with help desk software (Zendesk, Kustomer, Gorgias, etc.) and focus on helping large Shopify merchants deal with their high volume of support requests.

Top merchants using Yuma can automate up to 60% of their support tickets fully autonomously.

## Why do Shopify merchants need Yuma?

There are thousands of large Shopify merchants around the world generating $10M+ a year. Most of them have taken over some niches and are great at what they do: selling their products.

But they all have one thing in common: they all hate customer support. It's a burden for them and a huge source of cost, as they receive hundreds of requests per day. Some of them have dozens of support agents on staff, usually offshore, and the overall quality is still often pretty poor while staff turnover remains high.

Those merchants have been promised automation for years but have always been disappointed by the outcome. As customers, we have all had to live through a terrible support automation experience before, so this is no secret, and everyone knows that the current state of the technology is quite bad.

## Yuma is solving this in a few ways:

Yuma isn't just another RAG chatbot. Our platform provides autonomous AI agents dedicated to support and ecommerce.

These agents are powered by knowledge, follow processes, and are managed by our in-house AI orchestration technology. This ensures safety, control, and quality at every step.

We believe that to truly automate customer support, we must develop a platform that mimics the actions of a human support agent. That's exactly what we've been doing.

Currently, our top merchants are automating 60% of their support tickets through Yuma. Yuma can fetch information from external services and take actions in other apps as needed to resolve each ticket.

We are laser-focused on building the best AI support agent platform and aim to achieve 80% true automation in the next few months.

## Fun Fact

Yuma got started by accident. This is my third YC startup after Socialcam (W12) and Triplebyte (S15). I released Yuma as a prototype for fun in mid-December 2022 and was overwhelmed with demo requests. That's when I knew I was onto something and had to turn this into a real company, once again.

founders.name: Guillaume Luccisano, Founder
founders.description: Currently Founder @ Yuma (W23) - Previously Co-Founder at Triplebyte (S15) & Socialcam (W12) - Seed Investor in 60+ companies.

generated_description:
### Yuma AI Overview

**Name:** Yuma AI  
**Founded:** 2023  
**Location:** Boston  
**Team:** 12 Employees  
**Website:** [yuma.ai](https://yuma.ai)  
**Y Combinator:** Part of Batch W23  
**Group Partner:** Jared Friedman  

**Mission:** Yuma AI aims to be the ultimate AI support agent for e-commerce, revolutionizing customer service through automation.

---

### What is Yuma AI?

At its core, Yuma AI is about automating customer support specifically for e-commerce platforms. It offers an orchestration platform that deploys autonomous AI agents focused on enhancing customer service experiences for e-commerce businesses, primarily large Shopify merchants. By integrating seamlessly with help desk software such as Zendesk, Kustomer, and Gorgias, Yuma can handle a significant volume of daily support queries—up to 60% can be managed autonomously, drastically cutting down response times and operational costs.

---

### Challenges for Shopify Merchants

Many Shopify merchants, particularly those generating over $10 million annually, excel at selling but dread customer support—a task that often leads to high costs and frustrating experiences. With countless support requests flooding in daily, many merchants are stuck with high agent turnover and unsatisfactory service quality. They’ve been promised automated solutions in the past, which often fell short of expectations, resulting in poor customer interactions.

---

### How Yuma AI is Different

Yuma sets itself apart by not being just another generic AI chatbot. It leverages proprietary orchestration technology to train its agents in real e-commerce scenarios. These agents possess specialized knowledge and understand the processes necessary for effective support—this isn’t just a superficial interaction. Instead, Yuma's agents act like human agents, retrieving information from various external services and taking actionable steps to resolve customer issues.

Yuma AI aims to push true automation further, targeting an impressive 80% automation rate in the near future.

---

### Exciting Beginnings

Interestingly, Yuma AI's journey started as an unplanned side project—a prototype released in December 2022 was met with overwhelming interest, prompting the founders to embrace the opportunity and develop it into a fully-fledged startup.

---

### Core Features

- **Autonomous Ticket Handling:** Automates 60% of customer support tickets, allowing human agents to focus on more complex inquiries.
- **Integration with Major Platforms:** Works with widely used e-commerce and help desk systems to provide a streamlined support experience.
- **Pre-trained Knowledge Base:** Equipped with a rich repository of e-commerce data to answer customer inquiries accurately and promptly.
- **Scalability:** Supports scaling operations seamlessly without needing proportional increases in human resources.

---

### Why It Matters

In today's competitive online retail landscape, customer experience is paramount. Yuma AI not only empowers brands to manage customer support efficiently but also helps them maintain high satisfaction levels while reducing costs—this is the sweet spot many businesses aim for.

---

### In Summary

Yuma AI is a promising player in the customer support realm for e-commerce, cleverly leveraging AI to tackle a painfully common problem. With its laser focus on automation and integration, Yuma is well-positioned to transform how online retailers manage customer interactions, leading to happier customers and healthier businesses. If you're a Shopify merchant weary of managing support tickets, Yuma might just be the boost you need.
